wikipedia_page.main:
The Most Hon. (Arthur) Patrick Chichester, 8th Marquess of Donegall (born 9 May 1952), known as The Hon. Patrick Chichester from 1953 until 1975, and Earl of Belfast from 1975 to April 2007, is an Irish peer, former officer of the Coldstream Guards and a landowner. 
The eldest son of The 7th Marquess of Donegall, he succeeded his father in April 2007.He and his descendants hold 1/100 of the role of Lord Great Chamberlain due to the splitting of the role between sisters where no heirs male exist.
He was educated at Harrow School and the Royal Agricultural College.Lord Donegall is married to Caroline Philipson (born 1959). They have two children: 

James Chichester, Earl of Belfast (born 1990), and
Lady Catherine Chichester (born 1992).They live near Arthurstown in the south-west of County Wexford.

link_mentions.page: List of marquesses in the peerages of Britain and Ireland

response: Among notable descendants are Stephen Wilson, 6th Baron Nunburnholme, Patrick Chichester, 8th Marquess of Donegall, and Rufus Keppel, 10th Earl of Albemarle.
